title: LOOK: 10 highlights from the Art Fair Philippines 2017 - InqPOP!
text:
InqPOP! Entertainment Events Lifestyle Pop Culture LOOK: 10 highlights from the Art Fair Philippines 2017 LOOK: 10 highlights from the Art Fair Philippines 2017 Pauline Reyes | February 22nd, 2017 PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
Forty art galleries showcased the work of local and foreign artists at the annual Art Fair Philippines held last February 15 to 19 at The Link Carpark in Makati. What started out as a modest exhibition in 2013 has now become one of the landmark events for art enthusiasts every year. Even though we only managed to catch the last day of the fair, the venue–occupying three floors along with the roof deck–was still packed. Outside, the queue went all around the building until right before the event ended at 9PM. Despite the large crowd and having to dodge a lot of selfie-takers posing in front of the artwork on display, we managed to squeeze our way through the venue and take in “the best in contemporary Philippine art”.

3. This fun collage (mixed media on canvas) called “Rolly the Curly in Board Shorts” by Richard Quebral: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
4. This amazing piece called “Space Between” created by Raffy Napay that used thread, textile cloth, and acrylic on canvas: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
Here’s a closer look at “Space Between”: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
5. This work by Gregory Halili on a giant clam entitled “Echo 2”: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
6. This glass and lights work by Gabriel Lichauco called “Astro Bling” made of stained glass, metal, and light fixtures: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
7. This mixed media sculpture by foreign artist Kiriku entitled “Skull of Flower”: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net 
8. This inventive piece entitled “Goodbyes” by Lara de los Reyes that used hair as thread on satin: PAULINE REYES/ INQUIRER.net
